task.summary:
Fixed folder structure, AB#554
- Fixed a weird issue where star.odyssey was a single folder causing any new addition (class or package) to the project to go into a star/odyssey.

Fixed folder structure, AB#554
- Fixed a weird issue where star.odyssey was a single folder causing any new addition (class or package) to the project to go into a star/odyssey.

POC Window appears, AB#555
- A window appears with nothing on it - Modified main/Main.java in order for the Window to show up as well as the Console

Button on Main Window, AB#556
- Added a button to the main window

Text on Main Window, AB#557
- Added a label to the main window

InputBox that accepts text, AB#558
- Added an input box, this one will accept text when Enter is pressed then clear itself, this text will be displayed in the existing label.

Game title screen, AB#559
- Added logic so the backend of the game is aware of what type of GUI should use (Console or Swing) /env/GameEnvironment.java - Added functional interfaces that handle communication between Swing and the game's backend, this will allow us to transition the game flow from a loop to an event based app. - Added a MainFrame class with a Pane inside that accepts text in different colors allowing the backend to send colored text - Added handlers in order to display the game's splash screen.

Game title screen cleared when the user press RETURN, AB#560
- Added a line inside SwingMainMenu that sends null to the MainFrame, this one will understand this as a "clear screen".

Game can be played in Swing, AB#563
- Added classes to send text to the swing interface - Added functional interfaces to handle communication between Swing and the back end - Added a flag inside GameEnvironment to know if the game should be played in the Console or Swing

Game can be played in Swing, AB#563
- Added classes to send text to the swing interface - Added functional interfaces to handle communication between Swing and the back end - Added a flag inside GameEnvironment to know if the game should be played in the Console or Swing
- Game is "playable" in Swing.

Game Introduction, AB#561
- Added game introduction inside the Swing interface - Fixed but: Display the map inside the game

Game winning and losing screens, AB#927
- Added screens for when the player win or loses. After which the player gets redirected to the Main Menu.

Game winning and losing screens, AB#927
- Added screens for when the player win or loses. After which the player gets redirected to the Main Menu.

Game winning and losing screens, AB#927
- Added screens for when the player win or loses. After which the player gets redirected to the Main Menu. - Fixed a bug that was causing the layout to not display properly

Game winning and losing screens, AB#927
- Changed the Main Menu image

Game winning and losing screens, AB#934
- Changed the Main Menu image

MESSAGE.value:
Fixed folder structure, AB#554
- Fixed a weird issue where star.odyssey was a single folder causing any new addition (class or package) to the project to go into a star/odyssey.

POC Window appears, AB#555
- A window appears with nothing on it - Modified main/Main.java in order for the Window to show up as well as the Console

Button on Main Window, AB#556
- Added a button to the main window

Text on Main Window, AB#557
- Added a label to the main window

InputBox that accepts text, AB#558
- Added an input box, this one will accept text when Enter is pressed then clear itself, this text will be displayed in the existing label.

Game title screen, AB#559
- Added logic so the backend of the game is aware of what type of GUI should use (Console or Swing) /env/GameEnvironment.java - Added functional interfaces that handle communication between Swing and the game's backend, this will allow us to transition the game flow from a loop to an event based app. - Added a MainFrame class with a Pane inside that accepts text in different colors allowing the backend to send colored text - Added handlers in order to display the game's splash screen.

Game title screen cleared when the user press RETURN, AB#560
- Added a line inside SwingMainMenu that sends null to the MainFrame, this one will understand this as a "clear screen".

Game can be played in Swing, AB#563
- Added classes to send text to the swing interface - Added functional interfaces to handle communication between Swing and the back end - Added a flag inside GameEnvironment to know if the game should be played in the Console or Swing

Game can be played in Swing, AB#563
- Added classes to send text to the swing interface - Added functional interfaces to handle communication between Swing and the back end - Added a flag inside GameEnvironment to know if the game should be played in the Console or Swing
- Game is "playable" in Swing.

Game Introduction, AB#561
- Added game introduction inside the Swing interface - Fixed but: Display the map inside the game

Game winning and losing screens, AB#927
- Added screens for when the player win or loses. After which the player gets redirected to the Main Menu.
